_meta.note: RFM segmentation template. Count and percentage columns are empty pending launch data. Scoring definitions and segment strategies are defined.

recency.description: How recently did the customer make a purchase?

frequency.description: How often does the customer purchase?

monetary.description: How much does the customer spend?

segments.definition: Best customers. Bought recently, buy often, spend the most.
segments.strategy: Reward them. Make them ambassadors. Give early access to new products. Never lose these customers.

segments.definition: Buy frequently and spend well. May not have purchased most recently.
segments.strategy: Upsell premium products. Ask for reviews. Invite to referral program. Subscription offers.

segments.definition: Recent buyers with moderate frequency. Have potential to become loyal.
segments.strategy: Offer subscription. Engage with post-purchase education. Build habit formation.

segments.definition: Just made first purchase. Critical window to convert to repeat buyer.
segments.strategy: Welcome series. Product education. Replenishment reminders. Make first experience exceptional.

segments.definition: Somewhat recent buyers who haven't bought much yet.
segments.strategy: Create brand awareness. Offer trials. Re-engage with valuable content.

segments.definition: Average customers in all dimensions. At risk of sliding.
segments.strategy: Reactivation campaigns. Limited-time offers. Personalized product recommendations.

segments.definition: Below average recency and frequency. Showing disengagement signals.
segments.strategy: Win-back campaigns. Survey to understand disengagement. Offer incentive to return.

segments.definition: Were great customers but haven't purchased recently. High value at risk of churning.
segments.strategy: Urgent win-back. Personalized re-engagement. Direct outreach. Understand what changed.

segments.definition: Low activity across all dimensions. Last purchase was long ago.
segments.strategy: Sunset sequence. Final offers. If no response, move to suppression to protect list health.

segments.definition: Lowest scores across all dimensions. Likely churned permanently.
segments.strategy: Suppress from regular campaigns. Include in annual re-engagement only. Clean from list after 12 months.

segment_movement_tracking.goal: Track customer movement between RFM segments monthly to identify trends, validate retention strategies, and catch churn signals early.
key_metrics: % of New Customers converting to Potential Loyalists within 60 days
% of Potential Loyalists converting to Loyal Customers within 6 months
% of At Risk customers recovered via win-back campaigns
Average time from Champions to At Risk (churn velocity)
